  6. LAN = Local, WAN = World.
  7. Configure port forwarding on your ISP‚Äôs modem/router. Use UDP port 51820.

VPN Server ‚Äì Where you want to pretend to be

  1. Connect a CAT‚Äë5e/Ethernet cable from your ISP modem/gateway/ONT to the router‚Äôs WAN port.

item.title: What is a Digital Nomad VPN?
item.description:
Digital Nomad VPN Guide

Introduction

Let’s start this off with a few explanations so you can better understand some basic concepts.

First, think of the Internet as a giant map. There are addresses where you can access specific things, and only those addresses. To reach them, you type in something like www.IDontWantToBeHere.com (I don‚Äôt think that site actually exists) and hit enter in your web browser. Most people don‚Äôt know how that actually works. Your Internet provider takes that website‚Äôs URL and looks it up in a ‚Äúphone book‚Äù until it finds a ‚Äúphone number‚Äù used to dial that location. When you enter that address, the phone book shows the address 127.0.0.1 and dials that number. It‚Äôs that simple.

item.title: How I Became a Digital Nomad?
item.description:
In 2015, I was on my way to graduate school in Germany. I made it as far as Amsterdam when I was unexpectedly hospitalized for 15 days. Unfortunately, the program began on the seventh day of my stay, and the German university would not allow a late start. My plans collapsed, and I had to return to the United States.

By then, we had already sold our house, so I needed to find a new place to live quickly. My requirements were clear: the location had to be inexpensive, have reliable high‚Äëspeed internet, be near a major international airport, and ‚Äî most importantly ‚Äî be somewhere warm, where ‚Äúsnow‚Äù was a foreign word and the only ice you encountered was in your drink.
